BROOM: A domestic utensil with fibers bound together at the end of a long handle, used for sweeping.
CHIMNEY: A vertical tube or hollow column used to emit environmentally polluting gaseous and solid matter (including but not limited to by-products of burning carbon or hydrocarbon based fuels); a flue.
FLUE: A pipe or duct that carries gaseous combustion products away from the point of combustion (such as a furnace).
HEARTH: A brick, stone or cement floor to a fireplace or oven.
MANTEL: The shelf above a fireplace which may be also a structural support for the masonry of the chimney.
POKER: A metal rod, generally of wrought iron, for adjusting the burning logs or coals in a fire; a firestick.
SCREEN: A physical divider intended to block an area from view, or provide shelter from something dangerous.
